dc:title: On Pilgrimage - February 1964
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Reflects on voluntary poverty against the backdrop of stories of theft and being taken advantage of by guests. Asks if we are ready to be robbed of our goods, relinquish what we have, and share with the poor. "Do we really welcome poverty as liberating?"
